Package ss.project.gamelogic

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.project.gamelogic.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The main game logic class of the Collecto game. A model class, as it stores board states and handles rules and algorithms.
    Author:
    Alex Petrov (s2478412) and Kagan Gulsum (s2596091)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board()
      Constructing a board until a valid coloring and a valid initial move is satisfied.
      Board​(int[] numbers)
      For construction of board in the client based on data from server.
      Board​(Ball[][] ballArray)
      For testing purposes.

      • convertIntToBall

        public Ball convertIntToBall​(int number)
        A converter between integers and balls.
        Parameters:
        number - To be converted into a ball.
        Returns:
        The ball associated with that number.
        Requires
        0 <= number && number <= 6

      • convertBallToInt

        A converter between balls and integers.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Integer representation of the ball.
        Requires
        ball != null
        Ensures
        0 <= \result && \result <= 6

      • newGameString

        public java.lang.String newGameString()
        Returns a protocol appropriate representation of the board.

      • getBall

        public Ball getBall​(int row,
                    int col)
        Get the ball in the specified row, column pair. (Mainly for testing purposes).
        Parameters:
        row - specifying the row number
        col - specifying the column number
        Returns:
        ball located in the row, col pair
        Requires
        (row >= 0) && (row <= 6) && (col >= 0) && (col <= 6)

      • getFields

        public Ball[][] getFields()
        Returns the fields of this board class.

      • clearFields

        public void clearFields()
        Set every field to Ball.EMPTY.
        Ensures
        \all(getBall(row, col)) == Ball.EMPTY

      • fieldDeepCopy

        public Ball[][] fieldDeepCopy​(Ball[][] field)
        Creates and returns a deep copy of the current board.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the board

      • checkBoardEmpty

        public boolean checkBoardEmpty()
        Check if there are any non-empty balls on the board.
        Returns:
        false if there is at least one non-empty ball. true otherwise.

      • checkFieldEmpty

        public boolean checkFieldEmpty​(Ball[][] field,
                               int row,
                               int col)
        Check if, for the given field, the row, column pair is an empty field.
        Parameters:
        field -
        row -
        column -
        Returns:
        true if the specified field is empty, false otherwise.

      • getColors

        public java.util.List<Ball> getColors()
        Creating a list consisting of eight of every color. To be used in the board initialization.
        Returns:
        a list of all the balls required to play Collecto

      • initBoard

        public boolean initBoard()
        A completely random board initialization where random balls are picked from a list, and are assigned to the next available field with checks which make it impossible for two adjacent colors to come next to each other.
        Returns:
        false if the randomization made it impossible to avoid adjacency, true otherwise.

      • getAdjacent

        public java.util.List<int[]> getAdjacent​(Ball[][] field)
        Check every ball, and if they have an adjacent ball with the same color. Store its row and col in an integer array and put that array to the resulting list.
        Returns:
        a list of integer arrays indicating the indexes of adjacent balls
        Requires
        field != null

      • handleAdjacency

        public java.util.List<Ball> handleAdjacency​(Ball[][] field)
        Change every adjacent ball to an empty one and store them in a list.
        Returns:
        a list of balls which are adjacent
        Requires
        field != null

      • possibleSingleMove

        public boolean possibleSingleMove​(Ball[][] field)
        Check every possible single move and see if there is any adjacency.
        Returns:
        true if there happened to be adjacent balls after a single move, false otherwise.
        Requires
        field != null

      • possibleDoubleMove

        public boolean possibleDoubleMove​(Ball[][] field)
        Check every possible double move and see if there is any adjacency.
        Returns:
        true if there happened to be adjacent balls after a double move, false otherwise.
        Requires
        field != null

        Requires

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp​(int col,

        Move all the balls in the specified column above, without disturbing the order.
        Parameters:
        col - , field
        Requires

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        A method to check if the game is over.
        Returns:
        true if the field is empty or there is no valid move left, false otherwise.
